entry.title: Re: SAC Data Point Comment - Keeping Comments when Changi...
entry.content:
@onursoyer14 

I think in standard table it would not be possible. Data point comments get tagged to the intersection of all dimensions representing the value being commented on including the filters which are applied on the table. The below blog covers in detail the behavior of data point comments.

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/datapoint-commenting-in-sap-analytics-cloud/ba-p/13509143

 

Nikhil

entry.title: FUE consumption highly increased
entry.content:
Hi experts,

I'm writing because we noticed a significant and unexpected increase in our FUE consumption. Our balance has shifted from a surplus of 20 FUEs to a deficit of -25.

After investigation, I've identified the root cause: a number of users were reclassified as "Advanced" (at a 1:1 User:FUE ratio). I understand this is a result of the updated object consumption definition described in SAP Note 3113382.

Specifically, the authorization objects that were upgraded to "Advanced" in our roles are:

  • M_RECH_BUK / ACTVT / 01

  • M_RECH_WRK / ACTVT / 01

  • F_AVIK_BUK / ACTVT / 01

I'm already in the process of redesigning our roles to align with our license agreement.

However, my main concern is how to prevent this from happening again. Is there a roadmap or a proactive communication channel from SAP that announces these future reclassifications of authorization objects before they impact license consumption?

Thanks!

entry.title: Re: Calculation Key in Operations of work Order
entry.content:
Hello @Jaya0511 ,

Control key PM03 is used to capture the external services performed by a vendor. Internal manpower is not involved here. Cost of external services is captured in Service entry sheet. If you want to capture the internal manpower involved then add a separate operation with control key PM01.

Vaibhav Mishra

entry.title: Local Approuter not forwarding "x-csrf-token" header to backend
entry.content:
I have set up an approuter with a UI5 app and a route to our on-premise S/4 system and am developing locally on my machine.

In the browser developer tools from my UI5 app, I can see that the x-csrf-token header is being sent in the request, but in the Gateway trace (/IWFND/TRACES) I can see that the header is missing.

The result is that I get a 403 error response with the message "CSRF token validation failed".

On the other hand, when making the call via Postman, either directly to the on-premise system or even through a reverse proxy like Caddy, I can verify that the header reaches the S/4 system, and I can successfully perform an update.

The problem seems to be that the approuter is not forwarding the the x-csrf-token header to the backend.

Once deployed to BTP, however, it seems that the approuter is in fact passing the header along, because then it works.

My xs-app.json configuration looks as follows. I have tried with and without the "csrfProtection" option, setting it to both 'true' and 'false', but it makes no difference.

{
	"authenticationMethod": "route",
	"routes": [
		{
			"source": "^/sap/opu/(.*)$",
			"target": "/sap/opu/$1",
			"authenticationType": "xsuaa",
			"destination": "s4-backend",
			"csrfProtection": false
		},		
		{
			"source": "^/(.*)$",
			"target": "$1",
			"destination": "my-app"
		}
	]
}

The way I understand it, the approuter does its own handling of the x-csrf-token header, which presumably interferes with what I am trying to send to the backend.

SAP BTP, Cloud Foundry runtime and environment

entry.title: Re: How to refer to the quantity of another BOM component...
entry.content:
Create two reference characteristics in ct04; for example COMP_4929_QTY and COMP_4930_QTY and mark them as reference characteristics. Create a Class of type 300 using CL02 and assign both characteristics to the Class. Link the class to configurable material and to the BOM components if required.
Go to cu01 to create a Procedure that sets the quantity of component 1000014930 based on 1000014929. Go to cs02, select the component 1000014930 and assign the Procedure Dependency to this item.
With the above settings, test and update here

entry.title: Re: How to set the LD_LIBRARY_PATH variable for a new path.
entry.content:
I sove in Linux/Unix system  with editing bellow:

.sapenv_¬´host¬ª.csh
# add path for client HANA
setenv LD_LIBRARY_PATH ${LD_LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/sap/hdbclient/
setenv PATH ${PATH}:/usr/sap/hdbclient/
setenv dbs_hdb_connect_property "DISTRIBUTION=OFF"


.sapenv_¬´host¬ª.sh
# add path for client HANA
export LD_LIBRARY_PATH=$LD_LIBRARY_PATH:/usr/sap/HBD/hdbclient/
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/sap/HBD/hdbclient/
export dbs_hdb_connect_property="DISTRIBUTION=OFF"

DEFAUL.PFL para o ABAP e JAVA
dbs/hdb/connect_property = DISTRIBUTION=OFF

Note 1:  dbs/hdb/connect_property = 1761693 - Other connection options for SAP HANA
Note 2: You need restart instances to read again the profile and new parameters in OS
Note 3: Operating System Library Path Environment Variable
AIX LIBPATH
HP-UX SHLIB_PATH
Linux LD_LIBRARY_PATH
Solaris LD_LIBRARY_PATH
macOS DYLD_LIBRARY_PATH

I hope it helps
Sergio Vieira

entry.title: Re: CU62 - No authorization to delete change documents
entry.content:
Yes you are right. Change documents are audit relevant and they are used for compliance and traceability. Deleting them can violate audit policies. SAP recommends to archive instead of deleting.

What the other alternative you have is to archive the table instead of deleting it. Restrict delete access to a technical user. Use a custom role that allows table deletion but not change document deletion

SAP‚Äôs own documentation confirms this behavior: deletion of planned changes or change documents requires authorization checks, and they caution against granting this unless legally permitted. You can read more on  this SAP Help documentation.

entry.title: SAC | Linked Variables | Filtering on chart with two BW live models not working properly
entry.content:
Dear all,

I‚Äôm currently working on a story in SAP Analytics Cloud (SAC) where I‚Äôve combined two models for use in a single chart. Both models are linked via the dimension ‚Äúcal/month‚Äù and a corresponding story variable.

The challenge I‚Äôm facing is that updates to the story variable are not consistently reflected in the chart that uses both models. While the variable change correctly impacts separate charts based on individual models, it fails to update the blended chart after the initial refresh. Interestingly, the first change to the variable after refreshing the story does work‚Äîbut subsequent changes only affect charts that are not using linked queries.

Data Source: SAP BW Live Connection

First Refresh:

 

Second Refresh:

 

Linking settings:

 

Chart Design

I‚Äôve seen a similar issue raised in the SAP Community, though no resolution was provided. This raises the question: is this a known limitation, or could it be a product bug?

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-q-a/linked-variables-as-story-filter-not-working-correctly/qaq-p/12179295

Best

entry.title: Re: Multiple schedule lines getting clubbed
entry.content:
As you might be knowing, SAP uses copy control routines to determine how data flows from one document to another. In your case, it is from Contract to Sales Order. If the routine does not handle multiple schedule lines, it may aggregate quantities and default to the earliest date.
What routine is set in VTAA copy control config for "Data Transfer"? If it is other than 101, change it to 101, test the same scenario. Already if 101 routine is there and still you have issue, then, you may have to create a custom routine to take care of this requirement.

entry.title: Re: Product Allocation : Using Mask and Selective Restric...
entry.content:
When only one plant has constraints, the system expects plan data for all plant combinations. If missing, it defaults to zero confirmation. SAP PAL uses strict key matching. If a combination (e.g., Plant 2) has no plan data, it assumes zero allocation. To avoid this, you can Maintain default buckets with high allocation values for unconstrained plants, Use masking logic in the allocation sequence to allow fallback behavior, Consider sequence layering: define a first-level constraint for Plant 1, and a second-level fallback for other plants with unrestricted allocation.

If allocation is defined for some customers, others get zero confirmation due to missing plan data. So for this, define a default allocation bucket using a wildcard customer (e.g., #) with high or unlimited quantity. Use allocation sequences like Level 1: Specific customers with constraints and Level 2: Generic customer group or # with unrestricted allocation. This way, constrained customers are checked first, and others fall back to the default.

You want to use wildcards in plan data to simplify maintenance, but the system doesn‚Äôt allow it. As you might be knowing, SAP PAL does not support # or * directly in plan data entry. Instead, Use allocation sequences to simulate masking.

Finally, the ‚Äú0‚Äù column in plan data represents the default or fallback bucket. It is used when no matching characteristic combination is found and You want to define a catch-all allocation for unmatched demand. This is especially useful when using sequence groups‚Äîthe system checks specific combinations first, then falls back to ‚Äú0‚Äù if nothing matches.

entry.title: SAP PUBLIC CLOUD ABAP EML Defintion
entry.content:
When I use the BOI operation process and components of the production order, how should I define the type to create a table corresponding to the content in %target?
The code is as follows:

    MODIFY ENTITIES OF i_productionordertp
    ENTITY productionorderoperation
    CREATE BY \_operationcomponent
    AUTO FILL CID
    FIELDS ( material
             billofmaterialitemcategory
             requiredquantity
             baseunit )
    WITH VALUE #(
         ( %key-orderinternalid = '0000001161'
           %key-orderoperationinternalid = '00000001'
           %target = VALUE #(
           ( material = |{ '2' ALPHA = IN WIDTH = 18 }|
             %data-billofmaterialitemcategory = 'L'
             %data-requiredquantity = 22
             %data-baseunit = 'KG'
             %data-StorageLocation = '131A' )
                            )
         )
                )
    FAILED DATA(failed)
    REPORTED DATA(reported)
    MAPPED DATA(mapped).

entry.title: Re: Error Execution was halted due to an attempt to load...
entry.content:
I have a better solution . In some cases you cannot provide access to everyone.
The best solution is - Setup JDBC connectivity and move your oracle driver based connections to JDBC.
Below are the steps to be followed :
1. Copy Oracle/JDBC/lib from your C Drive to <SAP BO InstallDir>/Data Access/JDBC/Drivers . Rename it to Oracle .
2. Navigate <SAP BO InstallDir>/Data Access/JDBC/JDBC.sbo file , and define a classpath (InstallDir\dataAccess\connectionServer\jdbc\drivers\Oracle\ojdbc8.jar)
3. Navigate <SAP BO InstallDir>/Data Access/JDBC/oracle.sbo file , define the same as above.
4. Create a Classpath as new environment variable as : <InstallDir\dataAccess\connectionServer\jdbc\drivers\Oracle\ojdbc8.jar> 
5. Restart the server
6. Change the driver of the connection to JDBC.

entry.title: Re: Project purchasing with stock management
entry.content:
Hello,

If it's a stock material (a material which you procure and store in stock), inventory accounts are involved when you post the GR. Similarly, if you are using account assignment (cost center or project), the consumption accounts will be involved when you post the GR. So, it cannot be in the same time stock relevant and consumption relevant material.

The materials stored in stock can be consumed from stock using cost centers/projects as cost objects.

Additionally, you can procure materials on project stock, meaning they will be considered as stock materials, but they will be linked to a specific project/WBS element.

entry.title: Re: XD05 Blocking reason History
entry.content:
SAP doesn‚Äôt store blocking reason history in a dedicated table like KNA1 or KNVV. Instead, it uses the change document framework, which logs changes across many master data fields. How you can trace it is by considering the below tables

Why you are not able to see it in BP is because

  1. The blocking reason history isn‚Äôt exposed via a dedicated tab or pushbutton
  2. SAP doesn‚Äôt offer a native UI element for viewing historical changes to blocking flags
  3. You‚Äôd need to build a custom report or use transaction RSSCD100 to view change logs

entry.title: Re: Set Custom Story as Default Landing Page in SAP Analy...
entry.content:
@Eladtayarr 

You can configure the home screen page to some extent in terms of looks and feel but the option to set a customer story as landing page is not available. You can add the story as a featured story for easier access but to set the story itself in full view as home screen is not possible. Refer to below to see what you can customize in home screen.

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_ANALYTICS_CLOUD/00f68c2e08b941f081002fd3691d86a7/28908718d6bb431880a393d731ab908c.html?locale=en-US

 

Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Automatic Profitability Segment Derivation in "Post G...
entry.content:
Hello @Egorov_Evgeny 

Thanks for your feedback and remark

I consistently review and verify content before posting. I base my responses on trusted sources, including the SAP KBA database, SAP Learning, SAP Notes, and official documentation.


If anything appears inaccurate, I am happy to revisit it, provide the exact reference, and ensure that the facts are correct.

However, the Post General Journal Entries app (F0718) doesn‚Äôt support automatic CO-PA derivation. Users must manually assign and derive the segment. Substitution rules (SSCUI 102639/102640) won‚Äôt trigger it automatically.

Thank you again, and kind regards.
Chuma

entry.title: Re: ERR sh: 1: fiori: not found Error while deploying int...
entry.content:
Hi Alex
sorry for the delayed response, Please find the package.json file

{
  "name": "project1",
  "version": "0.0.1",
  "description": "An SAP Fiori application.",
  "keywords": [
    "ui5",
    "openui5",
    "sapui5"
  ],
  "main": "webapp/index.html",
  "dependencies": {},
  "devDependencies": {
    "@ui5/cli": "^4.0.16",
    "@sap/ux-ui5-tooling": "1",
    "ui5-task-zipper": "^3.4.x",
    "rimraf": "^5.0.5",
    "mbt": "^1.2.29"
  },
  "scripts": {
    "start": "fiori run --open \"test/flp.html#app-preview\"",
    "start-local": "fiori run --config ./ui5-local.yaml --open \"test/flp.html#app-preview\"",
    "build": "ui5 build --config=ui5.yaml --clean-dest --dest dist",
    "deploy": "fiori cfDeploy",
    "deploy-config": "fiori add deploy-config",
    "start-noflp": "fiori run --open \"index.html?sap-ui-xx-viewCache=false\"",
    "int-test": "fiori run --open 'test/integration/opaTests.qunit.html'",
    "start-variants-management": "fiori run --open \"preview.html#app-preview\"",
    "unit-test": "fiori run --open 'test/unit/unitTests.qunit.html'",
    "build:cf": "ui5 build preload --clean-dest --config ui5-deploy.yaml --include-task=generateCachebusterInfo",
    "build:mta": "rimraf resources mta_archives && mbt build",
    "undeploy": "cf undeploy project1 --delete-services --delete-service-keys --delete-service-brokers"
  },
  "sapuxLayer": "CUSTOMER_BASE"
}

entry.title: Re: Simplifying HTML5 Content Consumption Across Subaccounts
entry.content:
Hi @rupambhatta , and thank you for the in-depth tutorial. I just finished watching your lecture for the second time on YouTube, it's really helpful to have both supports! I am currently trying to recreate a working cdm.json in order to automate the creation of roles/groups/etc. So I've been working on a single subaccount for this tutorial (and maybe that's the cause of the issue!)

Because something does not quite fit for me: at the end of the deployment of the manageproducts app, the tile does not show up in the BWZ. 
- the app does show in the HTML5 Applications tab in the cockpit, and is running smoothly
- the two destinations have been created correctly
- the role have appeared in the content manager, it contains the app, and I've assigned it to my user and to the website
But still nothing!

Could it have something to do with the fact that I am deploying on the same subaccount, or is there something that I am missing and is the cdm only useful for cross subaccount deployment?

Thanks a lot for your guidance.

entry.title: Are you ready for administration tasks related to the Ariba Sourcing solution?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Administering SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing Solutions learning journey.

Overview
This Learning Journey helps entry-level consultants and administrators understand the fundamental administrative duties within an SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing realm. Explore how template administrators can access and edit project workspace templates that drive project creation within the tool. See how to maintain changes and settings to help streamline workflows and control business processes. In addition to project workspace templates, see how Customer Administrators can maintain project data and settings within their test and production sites. Learn about realm architecture and identify key configurations, parameters, customizations, and deployment methodologies that align with common data administration duties.

Learning objectives

  • Understand the fundamental administrative duties within SAP Ariba Strategic Sourcing.

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.
 
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: Approval of Time posted on WBS Element
entry.content:
Hello @maik1860 

Thank you for your question.

For time sheet approvals in S4 HANA Public Cloud Edition, use the Team Type TSH_APPR in the Manage Teams and Responsibilities app. This team setup works with scope item J11 - Time Recording and is used by the workflow for time approval.

Could you please ensure the workflow is active in Manage Workflows for Time Recording? Check below Approving Your Employees' Time Sheet Requests  and Manage My Timesheet 

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Missing 'Public' checkbox in VariantManagement ‚Äì UI5 app with P13n
entry.content:
@FabioPagoti

I checked the UI5 version on my system: the SAP_UI component version is 754, and when checking via the URL /sap/public/bc/ui5_ui5/index.html, the UI5 version displayed is 1.71 (1.71.55). To meet the requirements of my application, I need at least UI5 version 1.120, so I‚Äôm using the UI5 bootstrap to load a newer version manually.

The problem is that when using the bootstrap version, I cannot properly integrate the app into the Fiori Launchpad. Interestingly, saving user-specific variants still works. Specifically, Variant Management does not behave as expected: The USER layer is saved correctly in the backend. I can see logs in transaction SLG1 with object /UIF/LREP. However, the PUBLIC layer is not even displayed. I assume this issue is caused by the version mismatch between the manually loaded UI5 bootstrap version (1.120+) and the UI5 version of the system (1.71).

entry.title: Are you prepared using the SAP Business Transformation Center (BTC) effectively?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Unlocking Change with SAP Business Transformation Center learning journey.

Overview
Welcome to a new era of Data Transformation! This Learning Journey introduces you to the SAP Business Transformation Center, a cloud-based SaaS solution designed to streamline and optimize data transformation projects. Fully integrated with SAP Cloud ALM and powered by the SAP Business Technology Platform, it supports organizations in their journey toward digital modernization. Develop a comprehensive understanding of the Lean Selective Data Transition to SAP S/4HANA approach and its benefits using SAP Business Transformation Center. Learn which prerequisites are necessary and finally, gain insights into scoping, modeling, cycle and monitoring phase of a Lean Selective Data Transition to SAP S/4HANA with SAP Business Transformation.

Learning objectives
After completing this learning journey, you will be able to evaluate the benefits of SAP Business Transformation Center for planning, analyzing and executing a Lean Selective Data Transition Project. You can define the necessary prerequisites and preparations steps that are needed to use SAP Business Transformation Center. In addition, you learn how to use SAP Business Transformation Center in the scoping, modeling, cycle and monitoring phase of a Lean Selective Data Transition to SAP S/4HANA.

Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 
Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! We are here to support you. 

I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.
 
Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Use the new ‚ÄúDriven by AI‚Äù Attribute in the SAP SuccessFactors Process Library (SSPL)
entry.content:
Why the ‚ÄúDriven by AI‚Äù Attribute Matters

As organizations strive to become more intelligent and data-driven, understanding where AI is infused in business processes is critical. With the ‚ÄúDriven by AI‚Äù attribute, SSPL users can quickly identify AI-supported processes, making it easier to leverage innovative solutions for better decision-making and operational efficiency.

Examples of AI-Infused Processes

Some examples of processes now marked with the ‚ÄúDriven by AI‚Äù attribute include:

  • Plan Career: AI-Assisted Career Insights
  • Review Performance: AI-Assisted Writing in SAP SuccessFactors Applications
  • Conduct 360 Degree Review: AI-Assisted Insights into Detailed 360 Report
  • Execute LTI Review: AI-Assisted Person Insights for Compensation Discussions

Explore the Updates

Use Signavio Collaboration Hub to easily see which processes and activities are impacted by AI: select the process and make sure to have the overlay ‚ÄúDriven by AI‚Äù selected. If you click on the activity, it will also give you additional information about the type of AI used, as shown below.

entry.title: EEO Self ID During ONB
entry.content:
Hello,

We are in the process of moving from SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding 1.0 # to SAP SuccessFactors Onboarding #. For our U.S.-based employees who participate in EEO-1 filing, we‚Äôre looking for a solution to enable self-disclosure of Race/Ethnicity/Gender post-offer.

In Onboarding 1.0, we had implemented a custom panel that included the required EEO language and mapped the data into Employee Central (EC). In Onboarding 2.0, new hires now enter this information directly into EC fields‚Äîbut the EEO language is no longer present.

I've attached a screenshot showing how the panel appeared in ONB 1.0. While we understand that a custom form can be created in ONB 2.0, we‚Äôve learned that data from such forms cannot be mapped into EC.

Has anyone implemented a solution or best practice for this scenario in your organization? We‚Äôd appreciate any guidance or examples you can share.

Thank you!

entry.title: Comparison BO publication VS SAC publication
entry.content: Hi, In the SAC, I have created stories, e.g., story_1, and stories for the business need o/p file in the two formats. One is PDF, and the other format is Excel. Do we have similar functionality in the BO publication that allows one Webi template to schedule different formats to be sent to a business email box, a single publication?

entry.title: Re: DME file splitting based on amount threshold
entry.content:
Hi Anuja - Solution will work like this...

Step 1- DME (XML file is created.

Step 2 - File is stored in AL11 folder.

Step 3 - PI/PO will interface this file via encryption format to Bank (API Call).

Step 4. Bank will consume the entire file with various amounts.

Step 5- Bank will trigger workflow - allocate the file to respective approvers based on the amount logic built.

Step 6 - Approvers will login into bank site and approve the file allotted to their ids. 

Hope this helps.

Best,

entry.title: Re: Custom CDS Views - FAQ
entry.content:
Hello Roman, @roman_mozil 

no, Custom CDS Views as a Key User app is restricted to using C1 released CDS Views (SAP Virtual Data Model VDM) as Data Sources. Tables are not on the roadmap.

Best Regards
Andreas
